intro: Lithospermum oleifolium, commonly known as redroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its reddish-brown roots and violet to blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its stems are erect and branching. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its anti-inflammatory and antiseptic qualities.
